drupalNodeEvent.title: AI-tocracy: the Political Economy of AI

field_organizers.processed: Harvard University Fairbank Center For Chinese Studies

field_description.processed: David Yang is an Assistant Professor of Economics. His research focuses on political economy, behavioral and experimental economics, economic history, and cultural economics. In particular, David studies the forces of stability and forces of changes in authoritarian regimes, drawing lessons from historical and contemporary China. David received a B.A. in Statistics and B.S. in Business Administration from University of California at Berkeley, and PhD in Economics from Stanford.
